title.narrative: SP POLICIES AND LEGISLATION

description.narrative: Social protection and population policies/strategies and legislation developed and/or amended to reflect the needs of the most vulnerable population, which contributes to Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 relevant government institutions are strengthened to monitor child rights, reduce poverty and provide inclusive access to social protection services, including for the most marginalized children, especially Roma children and girls and boys with disabilities

Social welfare workforce strengthening - Case management, referral, capacity development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Social protection and population policies/strategies and legislation developed and/or amended to reflect the needs of the mostvulnerable population

description.narrative: One of the achievements in 2020 was the development, with UNICEF support, of Entity and Brcko District Social Inclusion Strategies which encompass a wide range of sectors with children and youth at the core of interventions. Comprehensive evidence was generated through rapid assessments on the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on social and child protection systems, which proved to be valuable inputs for cantonal social development strategy planning. Albeit delayed due to competing priorities, the multi-sectoral work on the reform of child disability assessment procedures progressed through the formalization of Federal and Cantonal Working Groups. | Status:Met | As-of Date:19/01/2021
